question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Key Type Confusion] If find_noise_proto() returns None for a VFN, is the NodeInfo still created with public_key: None, and can this cause downstream authentication failures or bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Key Rotation] If a validator updates their VFN keys on-chain between get_validator_infos() and actual connection, can this cause authentication failures or allow MITM attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Memory Leak] The or_insert_with(Vec::new) pattern at lines 90 and 106 - if validator processing is interrupted, are partially-constructed vectors properly dropped or can they leak memory? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [HashMap Growth] With unbounded validator_infos, can the node_infos and invalid_node_address_results HashMaps grow without limit causing OOM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [String Cloning] Multiple String allocations for error messages (lines 94, 124) - with many errors, can this cause memory pressure or performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Vector Ownership] The active_validators vector is moved via into_inner() at line 42 - is this efficient, or does it cause unnecessary copying with large validator sets? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Information Leakage] The info!() log at lines 43-48 exposes first and last validator addresses - can this leak sensitive information about validator set composition to attackers monitoring logs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Error Detail Exposure] Error messages containing {:#} formatting (lines 94, 124) - do these expose internal implementation details or stack traces that could aid attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [PII in Logs] Do validator AccountAddresses constitute personally identifiable information, and are they properly redacted in logs per privacy regulations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [API Version Mismatch] Does the code handle API version mismatches between the checker and the node at node_address, or can incompatible versions cause deserialization failures or incorrect data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Rate Limiting] If the REST API at node_address implements rate limiting, can repeated calls to get_validator_infos() trigger rate limits causing legitimate checks to fail? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [TLS Validation] Does the AptosClient properly validate TLS certificates when connecting to node_address, or can a MITM attacker serve fraudulent validator data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Redirect Following] If the REST API returns redirects, does the client follow them safely without infinite redirect loops or redirects to malicious domains? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Partial Construction] If processing fails mid-way through the validator loop, are node_infos and invalid_node_address_results in a consistent state, or can they contain mismatched data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Transaction Semantics] Should the entire operation be atomic (all validators processed or none), or is partial success acceptable - can partial state cause downstream logic errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Entry Overwriting] When multiple VFN addresses are processed for a single validator, they're appended to the same vector - can this cause unexpected behavior if downstream code expects a single VFN per validator? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Empty Validator Set] If active_validators is empty, the unwrap() at lines 46-47 panics - is this the correct behavior, or should it return an error gracefully? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Single Validator] With only one validator in the set, does processing work correctly, or are there assumptions about multiple validators that could cause bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Zero VFNs] When vfn_addresses is empty at line 103, this is handled correctly - but what if vfn_addresses is malformed (corrupted data structure) rather than just empty? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Duplicate AccountAddress] If validator_infos contains duplicate account addresses, does HashMap entry() handle this correctly or can it cause data loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Cache Poisoning] If the AptosClient caches responses, can a malicious node poison the cache with incorrect validator data affecting subsequent checks? (Medium)
